deck: The daughter of comic book legend Jack Kirby, and writer & co-creator of Jack Kirby's Galactic Bounty Hunter series.
description:
Bio

Â Lisa Kirby, Jack Kirby's youngest daughter grew up surrounded by creativity. Her father Jack shared his love for art and storytelling with his entire family. Jack worked out of his home studio, giving Lisa the opportunity to see first hand what her father was creating and the concepts behind the characters. This gave her much inspiration to write her own stories as well.

As a adult, Lisa's hope is to enlighten readers with some new Kirby creations! Characters that her father originally created but never had a chance to fully develop. Her goal is to keep her father's legacy alive, and to educate the public on the work of Jack Kirby and his important contribution to the Comic Book Industry. The only Jack Kirby creation she helped produce was a six issue story called the Galactic Bounty Hunters in 2006.

She is also a trustee of the Jack Kirby Museum and Research Center - A non-profit online museum dedicated to the life and work of Jack Kirby.

Lisa resides in Ventura Ca., where she enjoys her favorite pastime, surfing
name: Lisa Kirby

deck: Richard E. Marschall is an editor and writer. His most known work was with the Marvel Comics magazine division in the 70's & 80's on several of the Marvel Super Special film adaptations and The Hulk & Howard The Duck magazines, among others.
name: Richard E. Marschall

deck: Vice President of DC Comics Digital imprint.
description:
Formerly of Fleer/SkyBox and Marvel Comics, Perazza appeared as " Lieutenant Ron Perazza" in STAR TREK: THE CARD GAME.
Â 
Perazza was also author of the ' King James' comic, which featured LeBron James. The book was penciled Rick Leonardi.
name: Ron Perazza

description: Bobby Timony is the artist and co-creator of the popular comic strip âThe Night Owlsâ, published by DC Comics. He has been nominated for multiple Harvey Awards, including Best New Series, Best Online Series, and Best new talent as well as a Lulu nomination for Best Female Character and a Cybil Award nomination for best Young Adult Graphic Novel and is a bona fide âNo Prizeâ recipient. He is an active member of the National Cartoonistâs Society and lives in Burbank with his wife and bunny.
name: Bobby Timony

description:
Peter Timony is a member of the Horror Writers Association and the author of âThe Night Owlsâ, which was a graphic novel published by DC Comics in March of 2010, and nominated for three Harvey Awards that same year. It was illustrated by his twin brother, Bobby Timony. Peter has been called one of the most significant writers of his generation by his mom.

He lives with his wife Kerry in New Jersey.
name: Peter Timony

deck: Country boy Mike Kuty has dabbled in art, acting, and wrestling in addition to writing comics for Enemy Transmission, an indie entertainment company he co-founded.  His most popular creation to date is the bad girl biker chick, Valhalla Cindermane.
name: Mike Kuty

deck: Comic book writer associated with Hellblazer.
description:
Career

Mat Johnson was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and is of African/Irish decent. His mixed race ethnicity would later inspire the graphic novel Incognegro. Johnson currently teaches creative writing at the University of Houston.
name: Mat Johnson

deck: Ronn Sutton is a professional freelance artist and designer who is currently working on a variety of print and web comics projects. Ronn has also worked in animation, provided magazine illustrations and covered major trials for newspapers, web and TV as a courtroom artist.
name: Ronn Sutton

deck: Rex Maxon is a comic book artist.
description:
Rex Mason career started in comic art when he took over the drawing of the Tarzan newspaper strip in 1929, during the 30âs most of his output was for interior art in the Pulpâs, particularly the âSpicyâ pulps.

He went to work in the comic book industry in the 40âs working for Avon, Better, Marvel, Trojan, and Dell.

During the 50âs and early 60âs most of his work appeared in Dell comics where he co-created such features as Turok, Dinosauria, Young Earth, Young Hawk, and Track Hunter.

He ended his career in comics in 1969 when he and his wife moved to England and he took up landscape painting.

He died at the age of eighty-one on November 25, 1973.
name: Rex Maxon

description: Gary Larson is an American Cartoonist known best for his Far Side cartoon strips. His Far Side cartoon strips would be so famous that they have been collected in trades and found in merchandise such as Calendars.Â
name: Gary Larson

description: Â Born in Milan in 1971. Debuted in the comics world in 1994 on the pages of the publisher of Virtual Heroes username, then move on to the Demon Hunter Xenia Edizioni. Became professor of the School of Comics in Milan in 1996 with the mark of public school, the miniseries "Pulp Storiesa", and a couple of years later with Robert Recchioni and others founded "Factory" that creates "Milan criminal". In 1999 he began to work the series"Napoleon" by Sergio Bonelli Editore, the house that continues to work in years after switching to "Legs Weaver", "Zagor"; and "Dampyr". A Diabolik came in 2004, in the guise of subjects and from 2010 also in a screenwriter.
name: Diego Cajelli

deck:
Marcelo Pont is an argentinian writer and comic artist, his character Jiurban was published in the mythical Fierro in the 1980 decade.
Actually is published in La Duendes, Historieta Patagonica and his own blog http://jiurban.blogspot.com
He is also Production Designer and Art Director (Oscar winner The Secret in Their Eyes)
name: Marcelo Pont
